docs.title: Pipelines
docs.description: Semaphore supports simple pipelines with using build and deploy tasks.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.description: Semaphore can be configured using several methods:

docs.title: Interactive setup
docs.description: Use this option for first time configuration (not working for Semaphore installed via Snap).

docs.title: Environment variables
docs.description: With using environment variables you can override any available configuration option.

docs.title: Snap configuration
docs.description: Snap configurations should be used for when Semaphore was installed via Snap.

docs.title: Installation
docs.description: You can install Semaphore in multiple ways, depending on your operating system, environment, and preferences:

docs.title: Cloud deployment
docs.description: You can run Semaphore in any cloud environment using the same supported installation methods:

docs.title: Introduction
docs.description: Welcome to the Semaphore UI Administration Guide. This guide provides comprehensive information for installing, configuring, and maintaining your Semaphore instance.

docs.title: LDAP configuration
docs.description: Configuration file contains the following LDAP parameters:

docs.title: Logs
docs.description: Semaphore writes server logs to stdout and stores Task and Activity logs in a database, centralizing key log information and eliminating the need to back up log files separately. The only data stored on the file system is caching data.

docs.title: Notifications
docs.description: Semaphore can send notifications about task and project activity to popular channels. Configure a global notifier in config.json, and (where supported) override certain options per project.

docs.title: OpenID
docs.description: Semaphore supports authentication via OpenID Connect (OIDC).

docs.title: Administration Guide
docs.description: Welcome to the Semaphore UI Administration Guide. This guide provides comprehensive information for installing, configuring, and maintaining your Semaphore instance.

docs.title: Runners
docs.description: Runners enable running tasks on a separate server from Semaphore UI.

docs.title: Upgrading
docs.description: There are 4 ways for upgrading Semaphore:

docs.title: Variable Groups
docs.description: The Variable Groups section of Semaphore is a place to store additional variables for an inventory and must be stored in JSON format.

previous.title: Netbox Dynamic Inventory Integration with Semaphore

docs.title: Integrations
docs.description: Integrations allow establishing interaction between Semaphore and external services, such as GitHub and GitLab.

docs.title: Inventory
docs.description: An Inventory is a file that contains a list of hosts Ansible will run plays against.

next.title: Netbox Dynamic Inventory Integration with Semaphore

docs.title: Key Store
docs.description: The Key Store in Semaphore is used to store credentials for accessing remote Repositories, accessing remote hosts, sudo credentials, and Ansible vault passwords.

docs.title: Netbox Dynamic Inventory Integration with Semaphore
Projects
docs.description: A project is a place to separate management activity.

docs.title: User Guide
docs.description: Learn how to use Semaphore day-to-day: create projects, run tasks, manage inventories, keys, variables, and more.

docs.title: Repositories
docs.description: A Repository is a place to store and manage Ansible content like playbooks and roles.

docs.title: Schedules
docs.description: The schedule function in Semaphore allows to automate the execution of templates (e.g. playbook runs) at predefined intervals. This feature allows to implement routine automation tasks, such as regular backups, compliance checks, system updates, and more.

docs.title: Task Templates
docs.description: Templates define how to run Semaphore tasks. Currently the following task types are supported:

docs.title: Tasks
docs.description: A task is an instance of launching an Ansible playbook. You can create the task from Task Template by clicking the button Run/Build/Deploy for the required template.

docs.title: Teams
docs.description: In Semaphore UI, every project is associated with a Team. Only team members and admins can access the project. Each member of the team is assigned one of four predefined roles, which govern their level of access and the actions they can perform.
